intro: Rhipidoglossum orientalis, commonly known as the oriental tongue grass, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters at the base of the plant. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
